thread.title: State under mounting scrutiny for Flint's water crisis
thread.title_full: State under mounting scrutiny for Flint's water crisis - San Francisco Chronicle

author: David Eggert, Associated Press
title: State under mounting scrutiny for Flint's water crisis
text: Photo: Todd McInturf, AP Mich. Gov. Rick Snyder announces support in the city of Flint's plan to switch back to Detroit water due to high lead levels during a news conference in Flint, Mich. on Thursday Oct. 8, 2015. Flint stopped using water from the Detroit system last year as a cost-cutting measure, opting instead for a supply direct from the Flint River. (Christian Randolph/The Flint Journal-MLive.com via AP) LOCAL TELEVISION OUT; LOCAL INTERNET OUT; MANDATORY CREDIT Mich. Gov. Rick Snyder announces support in the city of Flint's... LANSING, Mich. (AP) — Gov. Rick Snyder and his administration face mounting scrutiny for Flint's drinking water crisis, which began when a state emergency manager switched the supply source to save money and has culminated with high lead levels in some children. Mich. Gov. Rick Snyder announces support in the city of Flint's plan to switch back to Detroit water due to high lead levels during a news conference in Flint, Mich. on Thursday Oct. 8, 2015. Flint stopped using water from the Detroit system last year as a cost-cutting measure, opting instead for a supply direct from the Flint River. (Christian Randolph/The Flint Journal-MLive.com via AP) LOCAL TELEVISION OUT; LOCAL INTERNET OUT; MANDATORY CREDIT Mich. Gov. Rick Snyder announces support in the city of Flint's... LANSING, Mich. (AP) — Gov. Rick Snyder and his administration face mounting scrutiny for Flint's drinking water crisis, which began when a state emergency manager switched the supply source to save money and has culminated with high lead levels in some children.
